page.title: 19PROBATION HOSTEL,WINDYRIDGE
page.content: There has been a large house at Windyridge since the 17th century,but its more recent owners have included Captain Kelso,whose widow sold it to East Andlian Regiment who used it as an officer rehabilitation centreduring the war.It was purchased by the Whitechapel Mission in 1954 and in 1955 it was opened by the Duke of Edinburgh as a probation hostel.The house now stands in 25 acres of land, but it is believed that at one time the whole valley was owned by one family.Much of the land is taken up with a farm which consists of goats, pigs and a small flock of sheep.Some hens and ducks provide free range eggs.A variety of vegetables and fruit are grown for the consumption of the residents of Windyridge.
